# init(cglContextObj:)

**Initializer**

Initializes and returns an OpenGL context object using an existing CGL context.

## Declaration

```swift
init?(cglContextObj context: CGLContextObj)
```

## Parameters

- **context**: The CGL context to wrap inside the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSOpenGLContext] object.

## Return Value

An initialized context.

## Discussion

If your application already has a CGL context, you can wrap a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSOpenGLContext] object around it using this method. This method retains the CGL context by calling `CGLRetainContext(_:)`.

Only one [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSOpenGLContext] object can wrap a specific context.

Your application should not call `CGLDestroyContext(_:)` to dispose of the CGL context. Instead, your application should call `CGLReleaseContext(_:)` to decrement its reference count.

## Creating Contexts

- **init(format:share:)**: Returns an OpenGL context object initialized with the specified pixel format information.
